issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: webhdfs
components.description: WebHDFS: HTTP REST API for HDFS

fields.description:
curl -k -i --negotiate -u : "https://hadoop3-4.example.com:20004/webhdfs/v1"

DataNode Web UI should do a better error checking/handling. 

{noformat}

comments.body: That's not web ui. We could make it fail more gracefully when required parameters are not provided in the request.  However, datanode webhdfs server is not meant to be a user-facing entry point.

Thank you [~kihwal] yes I should have updated the jira summary.
That said it would be nice to have the parameters checked properly
Probably make sense to throw HadoopIllegalArgumentException instead.

Thanks [~jojochuang] for the suggestions!

I have added fail() after invalid decodeFromUrlString() call in test case testDecodeWritableArgSanityCheck(). And I have replaced System.out.println() with Token.LOG.info() in patch v002.
